intro: Sohnreyia giraldoana, commonly known as the Guayaquil cypress, is a member of the Cupressaceae family. It is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Colombia. The plant features scale-like leaves arranged in opposite pairs along the branches. Its cones are small and typically contain two to three seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
